abstract.text: A search for rare decay η ′ → 4π 0 has been performed with GAMS-4π Setup.
The new upper limit for decay was established BR(η ′ → 4π 0 ) < 3.2 • 10 −4 at 90% confidence level.
The π − p chargeexchange reaction at 32.5 GeV/c was used as a source of 1.3 • 10 6 η ′ mesons.
Experiment carried out at the IHEP U-70 accelerator.

body_text.text: I. INTRODUCTION
Assuming CP conservation in strong interaction the direct decay η ′ → 4π 0 is forbidden, Fig. 1a.
body_text.section: I. INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: From other point of view decays with odd number of pseudoscalars belong to the wider class of anomalous decays, in low-energy QCD such anomalous decays are governed by the Wess -Zumino -Witten (WZW) term [1].
body_text.section: I. INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: In this approach the decay probability is not vanish, and there are as CP -conserving and CP -violating models for the process η ′ → 4π 0 [2][3][4].

body_text.text: II.
GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION
The experiment was carried out at the U70 IHEP accelator, in a secondary beam of negative particles.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The type of a beam particle is defined reliably by two threshold Cherenkov counters [10] with quartz optics.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The interaction point of the beam particles is measured with precision ±4 cm from the amount of Cherenkov light, emitted in the 40 cm long liquid hydrogen target.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The target is surrounded by guard system, which consists of scintilation veto layer and lead glass counters to detect recoiled baryons.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: This set of the detectors allows the identification of the charge-exchange processes with neutral final states.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The main detector of GAMS-4π Setup is the lead glass electromagnetic calorimeter GAMS [11].
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The central part of the calorimeter contains PWO crystals in order to provide good energy and spatial resolution [12].
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: A more detailed description of the performance of the experiment and data processing has been given elsewhere [13,14].
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The charge-exchange reaction
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: with a 32.5 GeV/c beam momentum was used as the source of the monoenergetic η ′ mesons The analysis of the data was performed in several steps.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: At first the 4-momenta of the photons were reconstructed by special procedures [15,16] and events with exactly eigth photons in GAMS were selected.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: Next, a series of criteria were applied in order to suppress instrumental and physical backgrounds without losing detection efficiency of the reactions under study (2):
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: • The distance between the shower centres in GAMS is larger than 40 mm;
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: • The distance between photon's impacts in GAMS and the beam axis is larger than 40 mm.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: This requirement provides suppression of the background in the central part of calorimeter where the beam is most intense;
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: • The total energy deposited in GAMS is limited to the range (28 -36) GeV;
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: • The energy of each photon is larger than 0.5 GeV.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: Mass spectrum of 8γ events after 1C-fit (fixing the mass of the recoiled neutron in reaction (2), fit probability CL> 0.05) is shown in Fig. 2a.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: 4π 0 system is rather difficult for experimental study, and was studied before in the reports [18,19] dealing with it in charge-exchange reaction.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: To estimate the background in low mass region 4C-fit was performed (fixing neutron and three π 0 masses).
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The non-fit γ-pair mass is shown in Fig. 2b, and one can see that in this hard kinematic region the integral ratio signal/background for mass interval (0.11 − 0.16) GeV is S/B = 1.1.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: ηπ 0 system produced with high intensity, and in case of the decay mode η → 3π 0 has four π 0 mesons in final state.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: Such η-mesons are seen clearly, Fig. 3a.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: To suppress this physical background 5C-fit (fixing neutron and four π 0 masses) was performed, and if the mass of any 3π 0 subsystem belongs to η meson interval the event is rejected.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: Pair π 0 mass spectrum consists of K 0 s mesons, Fig. 3b, but the contribution K 0 s K 0 s system at mass ≈ 1 GeV is negligible.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: Pure 4π 0 event mass spectrum is presented in Fig. 4a and exhibit a wide peak with mass around 0.9 GeV.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The origin of this structure can be explained by decays chain
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: with two lost γ.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: Taking into account that 105 possible combinations exist to compose 4π 0 from 8γ, the remaining eight photons can easy form 4π 0 system.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The method proposed in Ref.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: [20] was used to set upper limit for the decay desired.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The decays (1) and (3) are consider as the event sources for the experimental histogramm, Fig. (4).
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The mass spectra for these decays have been obtained by Monte-Carlo simulation.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The mass shift of η ′ peak position for decay (3) with two lost γ is ≈ 30 MeV, the peak becomes the width σ 5π ≈ 50 MeV, Fig. 4b.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: For decay (1) the mass resolution is σ 4π = 20 MeV after 5C-fit.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: One can see in Fig. 4a that experimental 4π 0 mass spectrum in (0.8-1.0) GeV interval is reproduced well by background spectrum (3).
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: The upper limit is evaluated as
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: where W (η ′ → 4π 0 ) is the weight of desired process (1), dW (η ′ → 4π 0 ) is the error corresponding 90% confidence level in generalized likelihood method 1 , N exp is number of the events in the experimental histogramm region under investigation, N η ′ is number of η ′ mesons and ǫ is detection efficiency for the decay (1).
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: No signal for the decay is observed.
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: At 90% confidence level the upper limit is
body_text.section: II. GAMS-4π SETUP AND EVENT SELECTION

body_text.text: III.
CONCLUSION
We have presented our result for a search the decay η ′ → 4π 0 .
body_text.section: III. CONCLUSION

body_text.text: One was found that main physical background arises from the chain of other neutral η ′ decays with lost photons.
body_text.section: III. CONCLUSION

body_text.text: This process can present a problem for other experiments, such as Crystal Ball [21], Crystal Barrel [22] WASA [23] to find the decay (1).
body_text.section: III. CONCLUSION

body_text.text: To reduce this background electromagnetic calorimeter used in experiment must have a low detection threshold for photons and reconstruction procedures capable to resolve overlapping showers.
body_text.section: III. CONCLUSION

body_text.text: IV.
ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
The physical problems related to the decay η ′ → 4π 0 were discussed with A.K. Likhoded, A.V. Luchinsky, V.V. Kiselev, V.F. Obraztsov, G.P. Pronko and A.L. Kataev, V.A. Rubakov (INR, Moscow).
body_text.section: IV. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

body_text.text: We are grateful to all of them for interest to our work.
body_text.section: IV. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
